item.description:
AGENDA for MAY 1st meetup...yep, next Tues!

We can have the most wondrous intentions but if our feelings are not aligned vibrationally on the
lighter side of gratitude and joy, don't be surprised if you don't attract what you want.

We're very delighted to have Lisa Wessan share with us wonderful ways to Let Go & Lighten Up!

side note: A loyal, joyous fan of our meetup, Lisa has participated since we started in January,
coming all the way from N Chelmsford ;o)

Lisa's gift to us is to share her proprietary "Lighter Side of Transformation (TM)" workshop with us
(which people usually pay a lot to participate and experience). Thanks-a-lot, Lisa!

Summary:
An academic and experiential workshop incorporating humor and laughter in
four parts "harmony".

Part I: Laughter Therapy: overview of the psychological, physiological and spiritual benefits of
laughter from peer reviewed journals.

Part II: Wit, mirth and laughter -- 3 components of humor. What distinguishes them?
Why do we care how we use them?
Harmful vs Therapeutic Humor...learn to recognize, so you can use the right kind of humor
...for joyful, intentional living.

Part III: Join in the full, interactive group experience of Z Laughter Circle (see
www.MirthMaven.com for details). Together, in small groups, we explore the
wonder, joy and ecstasy of being able to laugh for no reason.

Part IV: Questions, discussions, suggestions for further study and integration of
daily laughter practice.


It's very important to come in comfortable clothes. So be casual or be square!

Look forward to enjoying another wonderful meetup with everyone!

Be happy!
Chew-Hoong & Dave


About Lisa Wessan, MSW, LCSW, CLL:

Lisa is a joy based counselor & coach, licensed and board certified clinical
social worker, speaker and health educator.
She works with individuals and groups who seek pleasure and fulfillment
in their lives through improved energy and heightened consciousness.

Lisa has appeared on CNN's "Paula Zahn Now," and has been featured many
times in the national press, including The Wall Street Journal, The Daily
News and Adbusters Magazine, for interviews regarding her award winning
"Laughter Therapy for Caregivers" and "Team Building with Laughter"
programs.

Lisa is also an internationally published author, an active Reiki Master
and on-air host and producer of the monthly Cable TV show "Z Lighter Side
of Transformation." Visit www.MirthMaven.com for further information.
